item.title: NHK filming at CVSSP
item.description: During the weekend, the Japanese TV Broadcaster NHK came to film an experiment in face matching, comparing the performance of our face recognition system with that of a super recogniser, an individual with exceptional ability to recognise faces, whose company provides services to the UK police in analysing CCTV videos.

item.title: Face and soft biometrics recognition for smart cities applications
item.description: Prof Josef Kittler participated in the 3rd IEEE International Smart Cities Conference held at Jiangnan University, Wuxi, China on 14-17 September 2017. He presented a keynote talk on "Face and soft biometrics recognition for smart cities applications”.

item.title: Facial Recognition for Enhanced Security Applications
item.description: Professor Kittler visited New York University of Abu Dhabi (NYUAD) in the United Arab Emirates where he presented a keynote lecture on “Facial Recognition for Enhanced Security Applications” on 7 January 2017. The invited talk was opened to general public.

item.title: Unconstrained face recognition: Approaches to face normalisation
item.description: This two-day brainstorming workshop explores the various approaches to unconstrained face recognition. From model-based face normalisation methods to end-to-end deep learning based methods. Also video-based approaches, such as 3D face reconstruction and 3D model fitting, will be addressed.

item.title: 3D Morphable Face Model and its Applications (at AMDO 2016)
item.description: Professor Josef Kittler presented an invited paper on 3D morphable face model and its applications at the International Conference on Articulated Motion and Deformable Models 2016, held at Palma, Mallorca during 13-15 July 2016.

item.title: 3D Morphable Face Model and its Applications
item.description: 3D Morphable Face Models (3DMM) have been used in face recognition for some time now. They can be applied in their own right as a basis for 3D face recognition and analysis involving 3D face data.
